title: OCE in Esport
body:
To start off with my experience so you understand my POV, I've started to play at the start of 2016 (I tryed 2015 but I wasn't into it back then.)  I'm now Sliver 3-2 at this moment but that doesn't matter.

I want to talk about the topic of the esport around OCE.

I've been reading a lot of OCE boards lately but correct me if I'm wrong as I'm quite a young person talking about this.  I enjoy OPL.  I like it but its not exciting at all.  Their isn't anyone making 'plays' lately.  Our region low elo wise, I think in my opinion is a lot better compare to NA/EUW.  But the  small player base makes the top level kinda bad when we can't learn from other region because of our location and ping.  I'm very surprise that not much events happen in OCE at all (or that I don't hear about) so I feel riot should have a list of tournament for OCE that they could start up.  I think this would make the community a lot more competitive  and have some region guest as part to increase our knowledge of the game from a different region play style that we can take.

In my opinion, OCE could be a really good competitive region.  Sure our player base is VERY small but this also has it advantage.  I haven't seen anyone talk about how fast our region game play CAN change.  What I mean by this is that when a new meta is being played IN OCE by the top players, they can spread the game play and knowledge down the ladder faster as our MMR is kinda stretch so it reaches lower elo making the game have a better sense of the meta faster.  I'm pretty sure this plan is bad but I'm just putting my voice out.  One day, I hope OCE can do well in the wildcard rounds.  (Until then, I'm just gonna grind out my games to get as good as I can in the game as I LOVE it.)  (

I heard a thread about Tainted Minds but I don't want talk of that as I care about rioters feeling (I have no idea whats going on with the story)  

(Side track not with esport so you can skip this if you want)

I haven't had much flamer or trollers.  I RARELY get them which I enjoy.  (I don't want this post to feel like I'm attacking riot so I'm gonna give them happy vibes to make their day) 

TL;DR 

I started early 2016 and sliver 2.  This is my POV heading into this

I'm young so I will have lots of mistakes.  I kinda wanna revamp this topic
Its a boring region (High elo wise)
Low elo is acutally pretty good compare to other region
We can't get good I think because of Location and Ping
We could be a good region (idk, this is my opinion)
Meta spreads easily towards lower elo faster (Because lower player base) as so few people have good MMR
Good job with making our games enjoyable (To make Riot Happy and this post isn't about hating them)

!Ideas!

Make a tournament list yourself riot to make the player base play more
Bring over other teams from other region as guest players in our rank/tournament

Thats about it.  Hope you enjoy this topic.  I kinda just made this to revist to what seems to be dead topic in terms of acutally talking about it.

By your fellow Sliver player, Iliketurtle

(Please ask me what I have done wrong and what I can change and edit about it.)
(You can also post your opinion down in the chat as I would love to hear other people opinions)
(I'll add people comments I think is worthy with problems/idea/solution)
(If any Rioters are reading this, I'm not hating.  I'm just pointing some stuff out and to telling you my opinions and others in the chat)
(Also, Hi :D)

replies.body:
Hello,

We are a Facebook group that runs tournaments quite regularly for the community. Its is our goal to have an event on every weekend and run a ladder in the off season to help players keep growing. You probably wont find official riot tournaments that are not for pro players. Currently its up to the community to provided these. Riot OCE is quite small, so their main focus is more on setting up pro scene at the moment, which is fair enough, there really inst enough money in the scene at the moment. 

We have an article on tournaments and where to find them: https://www.summoners-society.com/tournaments-places-to-find-them/ 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/SummonersSocietyOCE/

So hopefully this can help you as a player and hopefully have more talent come through! 

As for your comments on improving the scene, the more the community get behind the pro scene the more money can go towards it and help it improve! So getting people to was OCS/OPL, supporting your teams with icons etc..  OCE is small and new, it will take time to get at place where its strong. 

Things that can help improve the scene
-Tournaments for members to play in, hopefully find new talent
-Supporting OCS/OPL (Viewing parties/watching it!) 
-Buying icons 
-Getting your friends into league of legends. 
-Share the events with family and friends 

Riot do really need to improve when events are on though, which I think this season they are getting much better at! Its very clear in the client MSI is on. They started a facebook page this year as well, their twitter is good for keeping update to date with events. 

OPL players don't have to study anymore and have gaming houses. A lot of them have the chance to put in 110% now, so over the next few season, you'll probably notice a big jump improvement. Teams are boot camping over seas now. 

Hope this helps,

SumSoc
Great info and initiatives - thanks for being awesome SumSoc! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

So generally who ever is our best team, normally legacy of the chiefs ends up smashing ever other team in oce, getting to the finals one of them wins.  Gos to IWCI and procedes to get smashed. Half the problem is riot doesn't really give 2 shots about oce and the other half is our pro plays still have to work and study they don't earn anything for play, out side tournament prizes.  Unlike in other regions like NA or LCK where they can scrim all day everyday

Hey Lakigr (and Iliketurtle)

I just wanted to provide you some information to see if it changes your perspective on this (happy to receive your thoughts either way though :P) - we definitely do care about the OCE esports scene, we invest really heavily in time and resources in building up the OPL to be a respected local scene and we are doing our best to help our pro players bridge the gap between OCE and Global skill levels. There definitely are complications around being so geographically isolated - they can't scrim China or Korea teams without bad ping issues, but we are definitely trying to solve this problem.

For the second point - the pro players earn a Minimum of $500 per match week of the OPL (which is 20 weeks a year) plus any prize money, sponsorships or top ups that the team provides them and we also help the teams provide gaming houses so that they have somewhere to live (i.e Free Rent) and they actually do scrim and train full time this year. Some probably do study still which is good, but this is their job now.

Anyway I don't want to just chime in with a 'listen to me I'm papa Riot', I just wanted to provide some context and hear your thoughts? 

I'm mostly glad to see that people are passionate about this topic, because I want us to be competitive as badly as you guys do!

so firstly u say that riot invest heavily into the oce region, yet I don't see it. We only just recently got all our teams into gaming houses and even when we did finally get them they sucked. Or at least tainted minds did. On top of that we have no tournaments in the oce region besides the OPL and that's it. so again I ask where exactly is all this money going as I don't see it any where. And what ever amount your do end up spending in oce on gaming houses or what ever else u spend it on. All it does is put us at the level that all the other severs have been at for years. Hell we are still 4-5 years behind the Korans. 

As for the second point just as a comparison in the LCK spring SKT T1 who took first place took home a grand prize of $89,571 USD. Now in the OPL split 1 Dire wolves who took first place only got $11,923.12 USD, Now I understand that we are a smaller region as such our prize pool is much smaller. However the grand total of the LCK prize pool is $264,234 USD the grand total for the OPL is $23,846 USD. What our players earn in comparison is shit all its barely any thing. I earn more as a cabinet maker apprentice than these guys earn playing at the highest level of play we have. 

On top of that they made us wait 2 years for a sever skin, when we finally got the skin we had to pay for it and on top of that not only did the skin not represent the oce sever in any way, the skin feels like it was put together at the last second and oce was told to just deal with it. Bloody hell huntress sivir feels more oce than what we got. 

Honestly it feels like oce is the forgotten part on riots to do list that u just stuff under all the other more important stuff and when you do end up reaching it, your just put in under another pile of more stuff

Completely understand your perspective - and I agree with you, we are still so far behind the LCK (who is literally 10-20 years ahead of every other region in terms of Esports infrastructure). I'd love to see our players earning as much as the other international players - it's a matter of supporting the competition as it grows, attracting sponsors and partners that can help us grow the OPL to the size/scale of the other regions, then we can actively grow the prize pools, player payments etc. The money we are investing is being spent as efficiently as possible, but it does cost a lot of money to run a team - we have seen some really big improvements in the team infrastructure across all the teams, as well as lots of amazing content being created and building up the profiles of the teams and players which is awesome - but it does take time to trickle through to results of course!

I also agree with your sentiment behind tournaments, although their currently is the OCS, OPL and OOL, as well as the Throwdown/Showdown pro-am tournament - it would be great to see more tournaments - particularly community driven ones. A thriving community of competition underneath the competitive scene is important and something we would definitely get behind. 

We really appreciate the feedback though! Thanks for taking the time to write it down for us.

OCS, OOL, throw down/showdown? Funny how I've never heard of or even seen any of what you're talking about being promoted. 

Also good job not talking about the server skin, is that cause he's right and you just don't know what to say or some other reason

Yeah sorry, I should have mentioned in the first response - I don't personally know the context around the server skin unfortunately so didn't want to comment with the wrong information.

Very interesting that you have never heard of the OCS/OOL or Throwdown showdown - do you follow the OPL Facebook or Twitter pages? We broadcast the OCS games each Friday on the main OPL twitch and make a post each split about the OOL and how to be a part of it etc. 

If you don't mind helping me understand a bit better - Where do you usually see things that we promote? Because maybe we aren't doing a good job of focusing on the right things in the right places?

Thanks

Ah ok, that's interesting to note - the OCS games are broadcast on the OPL twitch and the games are saved under videos on the RiotGamesOceania youtube, here is the OCS final for split 1 for example http://bit.ly/2qU3i9U 

Throwdown showdown is run by a community partner, so we don't stream that directly but they do, OOL also has some games that are cast by community members, but they are primarily not broadcast.

Sounds like we definitely need to explore sharing some more information about the semi pro and amateur tournaments in the client and maybe just more generally across our channels - I appreciate the feedback and insight.

Cheers!
